scenarioDescription:
The K2-115 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-115 is a star with 0.95 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.88 times its radius. It is located 1348.95 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10.7 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-115 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-115 system


K2-115 b

K2-115 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-115 b is 267.120 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-115 b is 12.060 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-115 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-115, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-115 - System With 1 Exoplanet
